name: The Raithwaite Estate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just spent the day then night here to celebrate my mum n dads 50th birthdays! Had a great time had lunch in restaurant that was great then walked the short walk to sand send to te local pub. On returning checked in slightly disappointed cause out of the 7rooms that were booked for our party ours was the only one that wasn't ready so we had to leave stuff in sisters room. Spa was busy but well worth a visit sauna and steam room were fantastic really hot, all family enjoyed. Ate evening meal in restaurant steaks were great in fact well rounded fantastic meal and service. Grounds are lovely and add to the relaxing atmospher. Rooms to high standard beds really comfy good nights sleep had by all. Breakfast equally as good as other meals.
reviews.title: Fabulous break!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 10 out of 10 had great time, will defiantly visit again!
reviews.title: Sadly disappointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel as a base for a short break. Didn't get the room we booked. Restaurant lacked atmosphere, and menu was not inviting.
reviews.title: Sit in the jacuzzi with a view to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd phoned first and asked for a Courtyard room over looking gardens at the rear, however on arrival we'd been allocated room 214 facing the front of the hotel. It was a large room but very sparse for a new hotel. TV was too small for the room unless you were prepared to start moving the furniture around. Choice of TV channels was poor. No fridge/bar in room, no trouser press. Nice ensuite, but the mirror was so high, I could only see the top of my head, and I am 5ft 4", so not that short. Room 214 adjacent to the delivery area for the kitchen and hence we were woken every morning of our 5 night stay by the various delivery lorries reversing into the tight space to deliver, and when it wasn't the delivery lorries, it was the construction team turning up, because what they fail to tell you on booking, is that they are in the process of building a second hotel in the grounds and adjacent to the Raithwaite.
reviews.title: Fabulous mid week spa break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spa facilities were pleasant, and I had lovely treatments during my stay.
reviews.title: Best Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 104 for my husbands 50th birthday.From the moment we arrived we were treat like royalty.Every single aspect of our stay was perfect.Do not take our word for it,go and find out for yourself! We cannot wait to return.
reviews.title: first class!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like other travellers, I can confirm that the staff at this hotel are very pleasant and accommodating. Particularly the girls in the restaurant. They really made us feel comfortable and very welcome. The food is also of a high standard and well presented. In fact, it's the nicest dining experience we've had in quite some time. The grounds and gardens are well maintained and a pleasure to spend time in. Just a couple of little niggles that i'm sure were particular to our room and no reflection on the accommodation as a whole. Our room, although nicely furnished with a beautiful view was a little on the small side. The bed was actually too large for the room and it was difficult to get down one side of it because of the proximity to the wall. The other little thing was the bathroom. Again, it was lovely and very clean but there was no space to put your toilet bag (other than the floor) as there was only a very narrow tiled shelf below the mirror. As I said, I'm sure those little hick-ups were probably particular to our room and I would have no hesitation in returning to Raithwaite or recommending it to others. We had a lovely time!
reviews.title: Great Get-Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights, mid week, what a stunning place to be. Everything from the consierge on arrival to the domestic staff - gardeners, waiting staff, reception everything and brilliant food wow - bring it on cant wait to get back!
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: The staff at Raithwaite Hall are the most pleasant I have encountered in any hotel that I have stayed in. From the first greeting from reception to the farewell from the gardener they couldn't have been more courteous and kind. Our room was lovely, with an outside terrace. The bathroom was huge, spotlessly clean and we had complimentary Molton Brown toiletries. We had an evening meal in the restaurant, the food was beautifully cooked and nicely presented, as was breakfast the next morning. All in all a lovely hotel, set in beautiful grounds and the nicest staff I've ever come across they certainly are a credit to Raithwaite Hall.
reviews.title: A really friendly place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a great 2 night stay here and the hotel and staff were excellent. If you are looking for fault you would be hard pressed to find one . We had afternoon tea one day and dinner the next. Both were really nice and the service impeccable by very pleasant waiting on staff, who very knowledgable also. Rooms were nice and if ours is the normal very clean and well looked after. The bathroom was also "spot on ", with the underfloor heating a bonus.
reviews.title: Relaxing Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a romantic weekend away and had a fantastic time at Raithwaite. It's situated just off the main road, which is up a winding drive. We walked down it and it takes 5 mins at the most and then you're at the beach. Our room (which wasn't in the main hotel building - one of the cheaper ones!) was lovely. It was spaceous, clean and bright. Most of all, it was quiet. Nice touch with a complementary bottle of water each before bed - just what we needed after sampling Poacher's bars yum cocktails. All the staff were really friendly and helpful. The electrics blew in our room owing to my dodgy hair straightners, but this was rectified after our return from Sandsend. THe hotel has a great spa and the breakfast was great. If you like to go walking and want to come back somewhere and relax, then this is the place for you. We can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Relaxing Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a lovely short break to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. Having stayed in a considerable number of hotels across the world, I can honestly say that Raithwaite Hall ranks amongst one of the best. From the moment we were greeted with a 'happy anniversary' from the hotel receptionist to our final goodbyes we were spoilt. Nice for the hotel management to provide us with a complimentary room upgrade and a complimentary bottle of champagne to greet us when we entered our Executive Room... The food, spa, gardens and staff were wonderful... and we are very much looking forward to our next visit.... must mention the breakfasts - nowhere have we had a nicer experience and choice... thank you staff at Raithwaite!!
reviews.title: Lovely short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a two night break.We were initially pleased to find an upmarket hotel in close proximity to Sandsend and Whitby.On arrival at Raithwaite Hall we were surprised how far we were from the sea, as the hotel is situated along quite a winding private lane.I did have a picture in my mind of an old hall full of character,however the building has been upgraded,extended and modified and resembled a contemporary new boutique hotel.In saying this,everything inside was new and very stylish though quite compact.
reviews.title: Not as good as we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedrooms have a luxurious feel about them with high quality furnishings.Small things let the standards down though.There was no radiator or heated towel rail in the bathroom which meant the towels remained damp after use.The heating was under the floor and at first the bathroom was very cold and took a while for the temperature to increase.The toiletries were Molten Brown and were very nice.
reviews.title: Our new favourite place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wardrobe was difficult to access as it was positioned at the side of the bed.The tea/coffee tray was inside this.A nice touch was the complementary homemade biscuits given each day.We paid for an upgraded room and didnt feel that it was worth it as we had no view.Light came in from a skylight and from a french window that had a three foot brick wall immediately outside.
reviews.title: Needs to improve...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two days away at Raithwaite Hall, the room was lovely clean & new, one thing the dressing table had a tv above not a mirror, & if your left handed its hard to see to dry your hair in the wardrobe mirror.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Large comfortable bed, very quiet during the night time.
reviews.title: Hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast excellent chioce & service was good, we did to have to wait on the second morning for a table but we were not in a rush so that didnt bother us.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel, with lots to offer for all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The gardens are beautifully maintained, & they would be great to walk round in summer.
reviews.title: WORTH A TRIP - VERY GOOD STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Service very friendly, & attentive.
reviews.title: A thoroughly enjoyable midweek break

description: The 80-acre Raithwaite Estate with its landscaped grounds is located in the coastal North Yorkshire countryside. Luxurious rooms within The Hall and Keep buildings feature alongside an indoor pool, spa, sauna, gym, 2 restaurants and 2 bars.With luxurious bathrobes, spacious beds and an en suite bathroom, all rooms on the Raithwaite Estate are individually designed. Some also feature a balcony or terrace with stunning views of the landscaped grounds.Local, seasonal produce is used in the Estate's restaurants, located within both The Hall and Keep, with both specialising in Whitby’s famous fresh produce from both land and sea.The extensive spa and fitness facilities on the Estate include an 11-metre pool, steam room, and a whirlpool. A range of indulgent spa treatments are also on offer and can be booked prior to arrivalThe local countryside, beaches, and nearby North York Moors all offer fantastic scenic walks. The historic town of Whitby is just 5 minutes’ drive away.
